titleStmt.title: Toleration disapprov'd and condemn'd by the authority and convincing reasons of I. that wise and learned man King James and his Privvy Council anno reg. 2do, II. the honourable Commons assembled in this present Parliament faithfully collected by a very moderate hand and humbly presented to the serious consideration of all dissenting parties.

Toleration disapprov'd and condemn'd by the authority and convincing reasons of I. that wise and learned man King James and his Privvy Council anno reg. 2do, II. the honourable Commons assembled in this present Parliament faithfully collected by a very moderate hand and humbly presented to the serious consideration of all dissenting parties.
titleStmt.author: Assheton, William, 1641-1711.
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Francis Oxland Sen. and are to be sold by John Williams,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to William Assheton by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
